channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Manchester Arena bomb: Three PCs on duty face internal investigations
item.description: Three officers are to face internal investigations over their actions on the night of the atrocity.

item.title: Bluebird: Dismantling Donald Campbell's boat only remaining option
item.description: The Ruskin Museum says its deadline for the return of the boat in one piece has passed.

item.title: Amputee gets blue badge after 'leg will not re-grow' letter
item.description: Amputee Ben Perry says his doctor is a "legend" for writing to a council to support his appeal.

item.title: Decades-old Broadstairs ice cream parlour makes it through 'difficult period'
item.description: Six generations of Morellis have worked at the family's ice cream parlour in Broadstairs, Kent.

item.title: Hungary v England: Visiting players racially abused at Puskas Arena
item.description: England condemn as "completely unacceptable" the racist abuse directed towards their players during Thursday's 4-0 win over Hungary in Budapest.

item.title: Bedford: Father and son jailed for Â£1.7m antiques theft
item.description: Des and Gary Pickersgill sold items including Chinese jade taken from an elderly widow's home.

item.title: 'Miracle' Luton bus crash cat looking for new home
item.description: The tortoiseshell cat needed life-saving surgery and five months care to recover from her injuries.

item.title: Reading stabbings: Bravery awards for police who tackled terrorist
item.description: The officers are honoured for apprehending a man who murdered three people in Reading in June 2020.

item.title: Councils hit by bin collection delays due to driver shortage
item.description: Some 18 councils across the UK are suffering waste collection delays due to a lack of bin lorry drivers.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence search: Sand Hutton lake drained by police
item.description: Aerial pictures show officers looking for clues at a fishing spot linked to the chef's disappearance.

item.title: Man guilty over abusive emails sent to Starmer and Thornberry
item.description: David Knott sent an "excessive number of abusive emails" to Sir Keir Starmer and Emily Thornberry.

item.title: Review bid after right-wing extremist 'told to read classic books'
item.description: As part of his sentence, Ben John is reportedly told to read classics such as Pride and Prejudice.

item.title: Paralympics: Husband praises 'incredible' Dame Sarah Storey
item.description: Dame Sarah Storey is Great Britain's most successful Paralympian after winning her 17th gold medal.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo superfan relishes Manchester United return
item.description: Dominic Urbani is so obsessed with Cristiano Ronaldo that he studied for a degree in Portuguese.

item.title: 'Wheelyboat gives me freedom out on the water'
item.description: A specially designed boat with wheelchair access is allowing disabled anglers to go fishing.

item.title: Covid shielder gets private opera performance in back garden
item.description: Ceinwen Giles is shielding from Covid due to her cancer treatment, so an opera was brought to her garden.

item.title: Mental Health: The ambulance workers feeding callers
item.description: A Merseyside mental health ambulance team is offering food support for its most in need patients.

item.title: England v India: Joe Root wicket leaves Kia Oval Test poised
item.description: England lose the key wicket of Joe Root late on a dramatic first day to leave the fourth Test with India finely balanced at the Kia Oval.

item.title: Sarah Storey says her 17th Paralympic gold 'feels like an out of body experience'
item.description: Britain's Sarah Storey says she "feels immensely proud" to have won a record 17 Paralympic gold medals and is hoping to add more at Paris 2024.

item.title: Premier League clubs could be banned from picking players not released for internationals
item.description: Premier League clubs could be stopped from picking players for their next game after refusing to release them for World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: WSL 2021-22: How can you follow coverage on the BBC?
item.description: The BBC will broadcast the first-ever live domestic women's league game on network free-to-air television this season.

item.title: Gareth Southgate says England must look at themselves before judging other countries' behaviour
item.description: Gareth Southgate says England should "get its own house in order" before criticising others for their behaviour.
